The paper says the best way to manage AI context is to treat everything like a file system.

Today, a model's knowledge sits in separate prompts, databases, tools, and logs, so context engineering pulls this into a coherent system.

The paper proposes an agentic file system where https://t.co/ZZyV4zRb38

tweets.full_text:
New @AIatMeta paper shows long context large language models miss buried facts, and fixes it with query-only test-time training (qTTT).

On LongBench-v2 and ZeroScrolls, it lifts Qwen3-4B by 12.6 and 14.1 points on average.

A large language model predicts the next token, meaning https://t.co/1fjW4LFUd2

tweets.full_text:
The end of an era, Stack Exchange that is.

They finished shutting down the physical server racks that ran its sites for most of the last 16 years.

The company moved everything to cloud hosting, and the last New Jersey datacenter hardware was physically removed in Dec-25.

All https://t.co/A1dlL0ebXz

tweets.full_text:
ChatGPT‚Äôs daily web visits slid from roughly 200M down to roughly 158M, which is about a 22% drop over the holiday stretch.

At the same time, Gemini stayed much steadier, sitting around the 60M-ish range, with only a small holiday dip.

A simple of read this could be that https://t.co/WTOoqoIKkN
tweets.quoted_text:
üö® ChatGPT traffic has fallen -22% in the last 6 weeks, since the Gemini 3 launch.

7-day avg visitors has gone from ~203M to ~158M. Might be the holiday slump, but Gemini, their biggest consumer competitor, has remained flat and is now ~40% of ChatGPT.

Source: SimilarWeb. https://t.co/lud3N6pRzK
